intro: Licania celiae, commonly known as the Celia's licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Licania celiae thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
